episodeTitle: In a Real Pinch! Luffy Sinks into the Ice-cold Lake!
description: The Straw Hats attempt to reach Punk Hazard's ice side but are ambushed by Brownbeard's centaur forces. After escaping the frigid waters, they steal warm coats from the centaurs. Meanwhile, Law uses his Ope Ope no Mi powers to body-swap Sanji, Nami, Franky, and Chopper, creating chaos for the crew.

events.title: Straw Hats Approach the Ice Side of Punk Hazard
events.description: Luffy, Zoro, Usopp, and Robin sail toward the frozen side of Punk Hazard on their small boat, attempting to reach the icy terrain of the island.
events.significance: Sets up the encounter with Brownbeard's centaur patrol and establishes the crew's objective to explore both sides of the island.

events.title: Brownbeard's Centaur Patrol Attacks
events.description: Brownbeard and his centaur patrol unit ambush the Straw Hats at the frozen lake, capsizing their ship and attacking them with gunfire.
events.significance: Introduces Brownbeard as a centaur and leader of Caesar's security forces on Punk Hazard, marking a significant transformation from his previous appearance.

quotes.text: Fire! Don't let those pirates escape!
quotes.speaker: Brownbeard
quotes.context: Brownbeard orders his centaur forces to attack the Straw Hats

events.title: Brownbeard's Centaur Form Revealed
events.description: Brownbeard appears as an alligator-human centaur hybrid, transformed by Caesar Clown and Trafalgar Law after being crippled by Basil Hawkins in the New World.
events.significance: Reveals the horrifying experiments being conducted on Punk Hazard and demonstrates Law's surgical abilities with his Ope Ope no Mi powers.

events.title: Zoro Dragged Underwater by Sharks
events.description: As the Straw Hats fall into the icy lake, Zoro is grabbed and dragged underwater by sharks inhabiting the freezing waters.
events.significance: Creates immediate danger for the crew and reveals that the lake contains ocean water, making it deadly for Devil Fruit users.

events.title: Brook's Ice Attack Saves Zoro
events.description: Brook arrives and uses his ice-based soul powers to freeze the centaurs' weapon barrels and save Zoro from the sharks, defeating the aquatic predators.
events.significance: Demonstrates Brook's post-timeskip abilities to use ice techniques and reunites him with Luffy's group.

events.title: Straw Hats Steal Centaurs' Warm Coats
events.description: After escaping the freezing water, the Straw Hats realize the centaurs are wearing warm winter coats and decide to steal them for protection against Punk Hazard's extreme cold.
events.significance: Provides comic relief and practical solution to the harsh climate while establishing the severity of Punk Hazard's environmental conditions.

events.title: Lake Formation Revealed
events.description: It is revealed that the central lake on Punk Hazard was formed from the massive crater created during the legendary duel between Admirals Akainu and Aokiji.
events.significance: Connects to the major world event of the admirals' battle for Fleet Admiral position and demonstrates the scale of their powers.

events.title: Law Destroys the Marine Battleship
events.description: Trafalgar Law uses his Ope Ope no Mi powers to completely bisect the Marine battleship, cutting it in half and rendering it useless.
events.significance: Demonstrates the devastating power of Law's Devil Fruit abilities and establishes him as a serious threat to the Marines on Punk Hazard.

events.title: Law's Shambles Body-Swap Technique
events.description: Law uses his Shambles technique to swap the hearts and minds of Sanji, Nami, Franky, and Chopper, placing them in each other's bodies: Sanji in Nami's body, Nami in Franky's body, Franky in Chopper's body, and Chopper in Sanji's body.
events.significance: Introduces one of Law's most versatile and bizarre abilities, creating major complications and comedy for the Straw Hats throughout the Punk Hazard arc.

quotes.speaker: Trafalgar Law
quotes.context: Law activates his body-swapping technique on the Straw Hats

events.title: Sanji Realizes He's in Nami's Body
events.description: After the body swap, Sanji slowly realizes he is now in control of Nami's body, leading to a comedic reaction about being in charge of Nami's physical form.
events.significance: Provides significant comic relief and establishes the comedic potential of the body-swap situation that will continue throughout the arc.

events.title: Tashigi Challenges Law
events.description: Captain Tashigi attempts to engage Trafalgar Law in sword combat, challenging him despite Smoker's warnings that her Haki is not strong enough.
events.significance: Demonstrates the power gap between Law and the G-5 Marines, setting up Law as a formidable opponent for the arc.

quotes.text: Your Haki is not strong enough to go up against him, Tashigi!
quotes.speaker: Smoker
quotes.context: Smoker warns Tashigi about challenging Law

events.title: Law Cuts Tashigi in Half
events.description: Using his Ope Ope no Mi powers within his ROOM, Law cuts Tashigi in half during their confrontation. Despite being bisected, she remains alive due to Law's surgical abilities.
events.significance: Showcases Law's ability to slice people apart without killing them, demonstrating the precise control and devastating nature of his Devil Fruit powers.

events.title: Smoker Confronts Law
events.description: Vice Admiral Smoker steps in to save Tashigi and begins his confrontation with Trafalgar Law, setting up their major battle.
events.significance: Establishes the conflict between Smoker and Law that will continue in the following episode, bringing together two powerful Devil Fruit users.

quotes.speaker: Trafalgar Law
quotes.context: Law uses his technique to body-swap the Straw Hats

quotes.text: Your Haki is not strong enough to go up against him, Tashigi!
quotes.speaker: Smoker
quotes.context: Smoker warns Tashigi about challenging Law

quotes.text: Fire! Don't let those pirates escape!
quotes.speaker: Brownbeard
quotes.context: Brownbeard orders his centaur forces to attack

themes.description: The episode explores the concept of identity through Law's body-swapping technique, forcing characters to grapple with being in different physical forms.
themes.symbolism: The body swap represents the separation of mind and body, questioning what truly defines a person.

themes.description: Law demonstrates absolute control within his ROOM, manipulating reality itself and showcasing the terrifying potential of Devil Fruit mastery.
themes.symbolism: Law's surgical precision represents ultimate control over life and death without actually killing.

themes.description: Brownbeard's transformation into a centaur introduces the theme of unethical human experimentation on Punk Hazard.
themes.symbolism: The centaurs represent the violation of natural human form for experimental purposes.

characterSpotlights.development: Law demonstrates the full extent of his Ope Ope no Mi powers, showcasing both his surgical precision and devastating combat abilities.
Reappears as a centaur after being crippled by Basil Hawkins, now serving as Caesar's security chief on Punk Hazard.
quotes: Fire! Don't let those pirates escape!

characterSpotlights.development: Reunites with Luffy's group and demonstrates his post-timeskip ice abilities.

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extended the combat sequences with the centaurs and added more detailed reactions to the body-swapping.
Brownbeard's character introduction and backstory were expanded in the anime.
The scene of Law destroying the ship was given more animation detail in the anime.

trivia.fact: Episode 586 adapts Chapter 661 of the manga, titled 'The Lake of Bandits'.
This episode marks the first use of Law's Shambles technique to swap the Straw Hats' bodies, a plot point that continues for several episodes.
The episode aired in Japan on March 3, 2013, but was available via simulcast in the US on March 2, 2013 due to time zone differences.
Brownbeard previously appeared as a human pirate captain in Episodes 490 and 512 before his transformation into a centaur.
The Punk Hazard lake was created from the crater formed during the ten-day duel between Admirals Akainu and Aokiji for the Fleet Admiral position.
This episode had a TV rating of 9.1% in Japan, ranking #6 for the week.
The Funimation English dub for this episode was released on June 9, 2020, over 7 years after the original Japanese broadcast.
